description: From French compositeur, from Latin compositor.

entries.meaning: A person who sets type; a typesetter.
examples: However late medieval copyists were supervised — and controls were much more lax than many accounts suggest — scribes were incapable of committing the sort of "standardized" error that was produced by a compositor who dropped the word "not" from the Seventh Commandment and thus created the "wicked" Bible of 1631.

entries.meaning: One who, or that which, composes or sets in order.
examples: I work as an image compositor.

entries.meaning: (computer graphics) A system that puts images together in a buffer (such as individual windows on a desktop) to generate a final display image.
